subtitle: the ability to observe without
evaluating is the highest form of
intelligence jidu krishnamurthy
one of the greatest thinkers of the age
but the Lai Lama
in the vast expanse of spiritual and
philosophical thought
U krishnamurthy emerges as a beacon of
independent thought and transformative
wisdom
born in 1895 in a small South Indian
Town his journey from an unassuming
child to globally revered philosopher
speaker and writer is a narrative of
profound self-discovery and a Relentless
challenge to establish spiritual
religious and societal dogmas
krishnamurthy's early years were marked
by Simplicity and gave little hint of
the spiritual luminary he was to become
his life took a dramatic turn when he
was adopted by the theosophical society
Guided by Charles Webster LED Peter how
Annie peasant they saw in him the
potential to be the world teacher a
spiritual guide for all of humanity
however in the 1920s krishnamurthy began
to experience a series of mystical
Awakenings which he often described as
the process the process often began with
the sensation at the base of his neck
which would then spread throughout his
body
krishnamurthy described it as a feeling
of immense energy sometimes so intense
that it was painful
along with this he would experience
heightened sensitivity to his
surroundings a sense of vastness and an
overwhelming feeling of being connected
to the universe sometimes he would be
incapacitated by the intensity of these
experiences needing to lie down and rest
these episodes were unpredictable and
could be triggered by various stimuli
such as the site of a beautiful sunset
the sound of a bird or even seemingly
mundane events
they were accompanied by visions
insights and a deep sense of clarity
krishnamurthy often spoke of these
experiences as being beyond the realm of
thought and intellect hinting at a
direct perception of reality that was
unmediated by the Mind
krishnamurthy believed that the direct
perception which he sometimes referred
to as choiceless awareness was
accessible to everyone and was the key
to understanding oneself and the world
The Awakening experienced via the
process caused krishnamuti to dissolve
the order of the star an organization
created to support his role as the world
teacher declaring the truth was a
pathless land and that no organization
Dogma or person could lead another to
Enlightenment this bold step was not
just a personal decision but a
revolutionary assertion of spiritual
Freedom marking the onset of his journey
as an independent thinker and speaker
teachings are a beacon for those seeking
true Liberation his emphasis on
individual Freedom goes beyond the mere
physical or societal constraints it
examines the intricate web of our own
thoughts beliefs and patterns
he believed the true Freedom cannot be
achieved unless one breaks free from the
shackles of their own mind
krishnamurthy's insistence on
self-knowledge is not just about
introspection but about understanding
the very fabric of our being he believed
that most of our sufferings stem from
our inability to understand and accept
ourselves
by truly looking within one can discern
the repetitive and often restrictive
patterns of thought that bind us these
patterns often formed by past
experiences and societal conditioning
prevent us from experiencing the present
moment in its fullness
krishnamurthy's teachings on living in
the now are not just philosophical
musings but practical guidelines
by letting go of the burdens of the past
and anxieties of the future one can
truly immerse in the present
this immersion brings Clarity
understanding and a profound sense of
peace
krishnamurti's perspective on meditation
is refreshingly different from
traditional views instead of viewing it
as a structured practice he saw it as a
state of being a continuous unbroken
awareness of ones in a world this form
of meditation is not about achieving a
state but about being in a state a state
where one observes without judgment
where thoughts and emotions flow freely
without attachment or aversion
freedom from the known is perhaps one of
his most challenging teachings
it asks us to step out of our comfort
zones to question our deeply held
beliefs and to experience life without
the filters of past knowledge it's a
call to experience life in its raw
unfiltered form a life where every
moment is a new discovery
the intersection of Science and
spirituality has always been a subject
of intrigue and exploration when two
great minds from seemingly disparate
Fields come together to create this
Confluence the results can be both
enlightening and transformative
such was the case with the profound
dialogues between jidu krishnamurthy and
David Baum a renowned theoretical
physicist
with his deep insights into the human
psyche and the nature of Consciousness
had always emphasized the importance of
self-awareness and the limitation of
thought
he believed the true understanding and
Liberation come from transcending the
conditioned mind and directly perceiving
reality as it is
on the other hand David Baum through his
groundbreaking work in quantum mechanics
introduced Concepts like the implicate
order and Hollow movement these ideas
propose that the universe is not
fragmented but is an unbroken flowing
movement of interconnected wholeness as
they engaged in their dialogues it
became evident that there was a profound
synchronicity between their perspectives
bomb's scientific Explorations seemed to
Echo krishnamurti's spiritual teachings
the implicate order for instance
suggests that everything in the universe
is enfolded within everything else and
this mirrors krishnamurthy's view of the
interconnectedness of life
similarly the hollow movement speaks to
the ever-changing dynamic nature of the
universe which aligns with
krishnamurthy's teachings on the
impermanence of life and the importance
of being in the present moment the
conversations were not just intellectual
exercises but were imbued with a deep
sense of humility and a genuine Quest
For Truth they challenged each other
questioned established Notions and
probed the very essence of existence by
doing so they bridged the gap between
the rational and the mystical
demonstrating that science and
spirituality are not opposing forces but
complementary facets of understanding
the vastness of reality the legacy of
their dialogues captured in words like
the ending of time and the limits of
thought serve as a focus for those who
seek to understand the deeper truths of
existence it is a testament to the
boundless possibilities that arise when
Brilliant Minds unburdened by dogma and
open to exploration come together in the
pursuit of understanding their
collaboration reminds us that the
journey to truth is multifaceted and
both science and spirituality can offer
profound insights into the Mysteries of
the universe
krishnamurthy's teachings while rooted
in Simplicity are vast and multifaceted
they touch upon various aspects of human
existence from the nature of the self to
the intricacies of Human Relationships
and Society he often spoke about the
dangers of conditioning emphasizing how
our beliefs ideologies and societal
Norms shape our perceptions and actions
krishnamurthy believed that this
conditioning often unconscious is the
root cause of conflict both internally
and externally
[Music]
philosophical insights into the nature
of the self provide a profound
understanding of human existence he
believed that the self as most people
perceive it is a construct an illusion
created by the interplay of thought and
memory
every experience we undergo every
emotion we feel and every aspiration we
Harbor contributes to the molding of
this self it is an Ever evolving entity
never static always in flux
however this Dynamic nature of the self
is not without its pitfalls as it is
shaped and reshaped by our desires fears
and Ambitions it becomes a breeding
ground for division
this division is not just an internal
conflict but extends outward creating
barriers between individuals communities
and even Nations
the self in its quest for identity and
significance often becomes a fortress of
ego isolating us from the very essence
of existence
krishnamurti stressed that by looking
deeply into the intricacies of the self
by questioning its very foundation and
understanding its transient nature we
can begin to dissolve these barriers
this dissolution is not about negating
or annihilating the self but rather
about seeing it for what it truly is a
temporary construct of the Mind by doing
so we pave the way for a profound
transformation this transformation leads
to a state of wholeness where the
individual no longer feels separated
from the rest of existence it's a state
of unity with the boundaries of the self
blur and merge with the vastness of the
universe in the state conflict ceases
and a deep sense of peace and
interconnectedness prevails
through krishnamurthy's teachings we are
invited to embark on this journey of
self-discovery to transcend the
limitations of the self and to embrace
the boundless expanse of life itself
krishnamurthy often spoke about the
limitations of thought while thought is
essential for practical purposes it is
always limited it is based in memory
past experiences and accumulated
knowledge as such it can never grasp the
totality of life
believed that our Reliance on thought as
the primary tool for understanding leads
to fragmentation and conflict he
proposed that there is another way of
perceiving a direct perception that is
not mediated by thought
this direct perception or choiceless
awareness according to krishnamurthy is
the source of true insight and
understanding this form of perception
bypasses the usual channels of thought
offering a purer more holistic
understanding
krishnamurthy asserted that it's through
this unmediated perception that one can
attain genuine Clarity and profound
comprehension of life's mysteries
krishnamurthy's teachings also consider
the nature of Human Relationships he
believed that our relationships whether
with family friends or partners are
often based on psychological dependence
fear and desire
this leads to conflict jealousy and
possessiveness true love according to
krishnamurthy is free from these
limitations it is a state of being where
there is no fear no desire and no
dependence it is a state of wholeness
and unity where the self is not separate
from the other
foreign
spoke about the need for a radical
transformation in society he believed
that this transformation cannot be
brought about by external means whether
it be political economic or
technological the root cause of societal
issues according to krishnamurthy is the
human psyche it is our greed ambition
fear and desire for power that create a
society Rife with conflict inequality
and suffering as such any meaningful
transformation must begin with the
individual
it is only when individuals undergo a
fundamental psychological transformation
that Society can truly change
krishnamurthy's insights into education
are particularly noteworthy he believed
that traditional education with its
emphasis on road learning and
competition is deeply flawed such an
education system according to
krishnamurthy conditions the Mind
stifles creativity and perpetuates
societal norms and values that are often
divisive and destructive instead
krishnamurthy proposed a different kind
of education one that emphasizes the Art
of Living
such an education would not just impart
knowledge but would help students
understand themselves their
relationships and the world around them
it would cultivate a sense of wonder
curiosity and a deep appreciation for
life in this context krishnamurthy
established several schools around the
world where these principles were put
into practice
krishnamurthy had a unique perspective
on religion and spirituality he believed
that organized religion with its dogmas
rituals and hierarchies is a product of
human thought and as such is limited and
divisive
Christian multi often spoke about the
dangers of religious conditioning how it
creates division between people and
leads to conflict
however krishnamurthy also spoke about a
different kind of religiosity one that
is not bound by beliefs or rituals this
religiosity is a direct perception of
the sacredness of life
it is a deep sense of wonder and
reverence for all of existence
such a perception according to
krishnamurthy is the source of true
spirituality
krishnamurthy often said the truth is a
pathless land by this he meant that
truth cannot be approached through any
fixed path or method it cannot be
organized codified or turned into a
system truth according to krishnamurthy
is a living thing it is to be discovered
Anew by each individual in their own
unique way
[Music]
Freedom as elucidated by krishnamurthy
is a profound and multi-dimensional
concept
it transcends the mere absence of
physical shackles and examines the realm
of the psyche distinction between
freedom from and freedom 4 is
particularly enlightening while freedom
from is a reactionary State often driven
by a version or a desire to escape
Freedom 4 is proactive and purposeful it
is not just about breaking away from
what confines us but moving towards a
state of holistic well-being
understanding and unity
freedom for is about embracing life in
its entirety without the dichotomies of
right and wrong or self and other it's
about existing in a state where the mind
is not fragmented by conflicts or
divisions in essence krishnamurthy's
teachings on freedom challenge us to
look Beyond The Superficial and question
the very nature of our existence it's
not just about liberating the body but
emancipating the mind leading to a life
of true Harmony and inner peace
his insights while deeply philosophical
are also intensely practical they touch
upon every aspect of human life from the
personal to the societal from the
psychological to the spiritual
krishnamudi's teachings
urged us to look within to question our
beliefs and assumptions and to discover
the truth for ourselves
they remind us of the sacredness of life
and the potential for transformation
that lies within each one of us
krishnamurthy's life and teachings stand
as a testament to the power of
independent thought and the Relentless
Pursuit Of Truth
he offers a Timeless resource guiding us
towards a deeper understanding greater
Harmony and true freedom
